page.title: 07EDUCATION 04160531
page.content: Our rural D-block is made up of four small villages.There is a primary school in both{Howden}and{Hunwick}but} young children from North Bitchburn and High Grange have to travel to Howden two miles by bus.As there are no Comprehensive schools in our block, after leaving primary school children have to travel to near-by towns.They once could only go to{Parkside {Comprehensive}which is a split site comprehensive.The children go to {Parkside-Crook}premises for their 1st &2nd years{Parkside-Willington}for 3rd,4th&5th years and if they want to go on to Sixth Form they have to go to {Wolsingham.}Some parents don't like this so they send their children to {Bishop Barrington Comprehensive}or {King James VI Comprehensive,}both in Bishop Auckland but they have to pay their own bus fares.
